text: Scrolling for an hour and nothing feels real anymore.
label: reality_drift

text: Every headline feels designed to provoke, not to inform.
label: reality_drift

text: Conversations sound right, but the meaning keeps slipping.

text: Online reviews all read the same—different names, same voice.

text: Group chats feel like parallel realities that never quite meet.

text: News cycles reset so fast that nothing seems to have consequences.

text: Photos from different events blur together into the same vibe.

text: Everyone saw a different version of the ‘same’ story today.

text: The internet feels like a stage set where the props keep changing.

text: I can’t tell if a trend is grassroots or algorithmically planted.

text: Everything looks polished, but strangely hollow.

text: Two friends argue facts pulled from totally separate realities.

text: The more I browse, the less I trust my own impressions.

text: Memories feel synced to the feed rather than to my life.

text: I recognize the format of sincerity more than sincerity itself.

text: After a day online, my offline conversations feel off-key.

text: Everything feels slightly staged, like reality with a laugh track.

text: I notice tone more than substance because substance shifts.

text: The influencer cried on camera, but the apology felt rehearsed.

text: Too many options, too many filters—I don’t want to choose.
